#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Incorporate Art Into Your Life and Into Your Child 's Life
#Text=Creative ?
#Text=Yes , You !
#Text=If you do n’t think so , think back to your childhood days when you made meals out of dirt and water : Yummy MUD PIES
#Text=… Think back to times when your family was hungry and you had n’t gone shopping yet and you made real meals out of whatever was in your refrigerator .
#Text=That ’s simple creativity and some of the best recipes come from days like that !
#Text=You do n’t have to be born with paint running through your veins to be an artist .
#Text=When we open our hearts and lives to creativity , we also invite other feelings in like :
#Text=Stress reduction
#Text=Self expression
#Text=Inner peace
#Text=Increased confidence
#Text=As a parent , it is not only important for you to live a creative lifestyle , it is equally important for you to teach it to your children .
#Text=Your child ’s love for the arts will depend a lot upon how you feel about it .
#Text=Through the process of creating art , children can :
#Text=Increase their awareness of themselves and others
#Text=Learn how to control themselves
#Text=Cope with stress and negative experiences
#Text=Enjoy the pleasures of making art .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Always have on hand a variety of creative , artistic materials .
#Text=These materials can include , but are certainly not limited to , crayons , markers , paint , clay , various paper styles , glues , and scissors .
#Text=Let them experiment .
#Text=Be specific with your encouragement .
#Text=Instead of simply saying “ I like your painting ” , say , “ I like how you used blue for the color of your sun , and the stripes on your frog are amazing ! ”
#Text=Do n’t guess what their art is ; ask them to tell you about it .
#Text=Choose a time and place without any interruptions .
#Text=Do n’t rush their creativity .
#Text=If they are n’t finished in the time allotted , let them finish it later .
#Text=Be sure to follow through with the finish day and time you both decide on .
#Text=Try not to introduce too much .
#Text=If the activity becomes too overwhelming , stop .
#Text=Remember it is supposed to be fun , so be patient with their learning abilities .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Now , you are ready to make a self portrait of your creative self .
#Text=Here ’s how :
#Text=You will need a piece of paper for each person , and a pencil , scissors , glue , and magazines to share .
#Text=Have each person sketch themselves on their piece of paper ( simple head , with eyes , nose , mouth , etc. will do ) .
#Text=Cut magazine pages in various colors and small sizes .
#Text=This can be done ahead of time .
#Text=Form a background behind the sketch with magazine pieces glued down .
#Text=Next , have them glue pieces onto their self-portrait sketch .
#Text=Place the pieces so that they form the eyes , nose , mouth and hair .
#Text=Hello , creative you !
